quest.name: Amidst the Apocalypse
journal: Mihleel has information that should serve you well.
objectives: Accompany G'raha Tia to Kama and speak with him.
Gather information in Kama while G'raha Tia is accompanying you.
Speak with Djinabaha while G'raha Tia is accompanying you.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Thanks to Mihleel, it appears we have a new lead. Let us leave no stone unturned!

dialogue.name: CUSTOMER04410
dialogue.text: Those poor merchants... Turned into frightful beasts, to the last man...

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Khalzahl made his home in Kama, a nearby residential area.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: From what I gather, Khalzahl lived there since childhood and was known throughout the neighborhood.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Kama...the name is new to me. How do we get there?

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: I'll write down some directions.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: I cannot promise that you will find what you seek there, but if nothing else, it is a start.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Come, let's see where this lead takes us.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: G'raha Tia is now accompanying you. Keep him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave G'raha Tia behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with him and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have G'raha Tia accompany you again, return and speak with him at the original location.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Speak with G'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways with G'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ask for directions.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The residents of Kama should know more of Khalzahl's circumstances.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If we follow Mihleel's directions, we'll be there in no time.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with G'raha Tia?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Very well. I will return to the meyhane for the time being. When you are ready to resume the investigation, meet me there.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And with that, we're off! Let us see what we can learn about the merchant Khalzahl.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: G'raha Tia has yet to arrive. Be sure he is at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Let's see... After leaving the meyhane, we're to retrace our steps and head back towards the aetheryte plaza.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: From here, we ascend the stairs...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, this must be Yuj. In which case, we should take the path leading southeast.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If we keep going this way, we should arrive in Kama before long.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Walking these unfamiliar streets is quite the adventure, is it not? I can only hope we can explore Radz–at–Han at our leisure once this crisis has passed.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Forgive me... I know nothing of this “blasphemy,” nor what caused those poor men to take on such hideous forms.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: That said, I could tell that Khalzahl cared deeply for his colleagues and clients. He did not seem the sort to willingly damage the trust they placed in him.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...And this must be Kama! We've arrived at last!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Let us begin questioning the residents without delay. No doubt someone here can tell us more about Khalzahl.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Given recent events, I imagine many are taking shelter indoors.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: To see the streets so empty, I wonder if some residents have fled Radz–at–Han altogether.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Visitors? Now there's a surprise.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You should have G'raha Tia accompanying you before proceeding with the investigation.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Khalzahl, you say? Yes, I've known him since he was a boy.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: If there was ever a man who was born to be a merchant, it was him. Always early to depart and late to return, he'd spend his days procuring the finest wares and seeking out willing customers. You could say it came to him as easily as breathing.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Sadly, business was flagging of late. No surprise, really, what with how dangerous travel has become. He was cooped up in his house from dawn till dusk the other day─no doubt wracking his brain for a way to turn his fortunes around.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Then, at night, I heard the door open. I looked out to see Khalzahl sitting on a bench, his head hung low. A man with the weight of the world on his shoulders...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I see. The situation must have been quite dire, indeed...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Did you notice anything else out of the ordinary?

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Nothing to speak of. Other than the troubles with his consortium, he was the same old Khalzahl. Cordial and honest, like always.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: These questions you are asking...has something happened to him? He wasn't caught up in that terrible incident at the bazaar, was he?

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: I don't travel much these days, but my daughter's told me not to venture outside. Stuck in here as I am, I've heard little about these bizarre goings-on.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Rest assured, the city is safe for now, but the situation may change without warning.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I urge you: stay close to your daughter, and be prepared to take refuge should the satrap order it.

dialogue.name: MAHTI
dialogue.text: Yes, I shall do just that. Thank you for your concern, and pray stay safe as well.

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: Hmmm...? Could you come back another time? I just woke up, and I'm not exactly in the mood for idle chitchat.

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: Hmmm...? Could you come back another time? I just woke up, and I'm not exactly in the mood for idle chitchat.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Well, that's one way to avoid the panic, I suppose...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Pardon our intrusion. You may not have noticed, but a great danger has come to Thavnair. I encourage you to stay alert, and prepare to flee the city should the situation turn dire.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But before we leave you in peace...pray allow us to ask a question or two. Did you know a local merchant named Khalzahl? If so, did you notice anything unusual about him recently?

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: Khalzahl? Aye, I know him. In fact, we spoke just the other day.

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: Like many others, his business was doing poorly. Still, it seemed as though he'd managed to turn things around, thanks to a generous order from Ruveydah Fibers. Why, he was practically dancing in the streets.

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: I haven't spoken with him since, but I assume it all went well. Djinabaha might be able to tell you more, though. As I recall, he was the one who brokered the arrangement.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Djinabaha at Ruveydah Fibers... This sounds promising.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Djinabaha at Ruveydah Fibers... Let's make a point to visit him after we've spoken with other locals.

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: I must've been working myself too hard... I only intended to take a short nap, but when I woke up, it was already sunset. Come to think of it, hasn't the sky been red rather longer than usual?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Discuss the way to Dharma.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Discuss Ruveydah Fibers.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: From what we've heard, our man Khalzahl was truly at wits' end.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And it all came to a head at the meyhane... Perhaps his arrangement with Ruveydah Fibers did not go according to plan? I expect this Djinabaha can tell us more.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If I am not mistaken, these stairs lead to Dharma.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It is...quite the sight, the red sky above.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: During the Final Days of yore, the heavens burned and the stars fell. Creation magicks run amok─that was my assumption when I saw Amaurot.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Perhaps the ancients believed the same─that the terror of a single powerful individual was the cause of their calamity.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And yet, those selfsame horrors now manifest themselves before our eyes. What could it be that sets the heavens aflame and turns ordinary men into beasts?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: They're farming silkworms... This must be Ruveydah Fibers, where we should find Djinabaha.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: We must protect our wares lest the beasts come again!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Djinabaha will not speak to you alone. Return with G'raha Tia accompanying you to proceed with the investigation.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: ...And hurry, I say! There's no time to waste!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Pardon me, but you are in charge of buying and selling here, yes? We have a few questions that we'd like to─

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but I simply don't have time to chat.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: If you haven't noticed, we have our hands full at the moment. We must carry all our wares and equipment to safety before those accursed beasts return.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: In that case, might we be of assistance? Perhaps we could speak when the job is done.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: ...Very well.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: You can start by helping us move our equipment. Ask the others what to put where.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: And you can carry our fabrics.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: Go through that door and speak with Kamala. She'll tell you the rest.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: Remember, these textiles are our livelihood. Handle them with care.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: You'll get your answers after you've kept your side of the bargain. Now, off with you.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: This area is for employees only. Out, out!

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: What's that? You've come to help!? Oh, praise be to Minduruva!

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: Kind stranger, I welcome your assistance. On your way here, you passed three storehouses, yes?

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: I'd like you to carry that small crate to Nahbrifhal, by the storehouse near the hatchery.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: The crate of clothing is for Mahnuha...

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: ...And that massive crate there goes to Zeymeira by the middle storehouse. Watch your back with that one.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: Those are all the crates we have ready. Once they've been delivered, consider your work here complete!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have a limited time to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.

dialogue.name: NAHBRIFHAL
dialogue.text: This is where we store all our instruments and materials for both our silkworm hatchery and weaving workshop. I would show you around, but I'm expecting a delivery any moment now.

dialogue.name: NAHBRIFHAL
dialogue.text: Thread, is it? Then you've come to the right place. We thank you for your aid.

dialogue.name: MAHNUHA
dialogue.text: This storehouse is where we keep our finished products. Carpets, curtains, assorted garments and the like. Needless to say, we keep it tightly guarded.

dialogue.name: MAHNUHA
dialogue.text: If you have any crates of finished products such as carpets, clothing, and the like, pray bring them here to our primary storehouse.

dialogue.name: MAHNUHA
dialogue.text: A crateful of clothing, is it? I can take that off your hands. Many thanks for the delivery!

dialogue.name: ZEYMEIRA
dialogue.text: The crates we keep here are packed to the brim with fabrics, and it might surprise you just how heavy they can get. Do take care to lift with your legs, or you'll regret it!

dialogue.name: ZEYMEIRA
dialogue.text: I say, you're quite the brawny one, aren't you? A good thing, that. Never know when you'll need to defend yourself in these unpredictable times.

dialogue.name: ZEYMEIRA
dialogue.text: A crateful of fabrics, is it? Exactly what I was hoping to receive. Here, let me put that away for you.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: You've carried all the crates to the storehouses, you say? And so quickly, too! Why, I've never seen anyone so strong!

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: I and my associates will see to the rest, so please return to Djinabaha and assure him our work is proceeding apace.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: To tell the truth, we're grateful for this distraction. Too many terrible happenings of late. But generous souls like yourself give me hope that we may emerge from this trial even stronger. I pray we meet again in more peaceful times.

dialogue.name: KAMALA
dialogue.text: Pack it all up, and quickly, now! We'll not let any of our precious fabrics be trampled and torn by those beasts!

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: Done as I asked, have you?

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: If Kamala is satisfied with your work, then so am I. You have done us a great favor, traveler.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I, too, have delivered the instruments and apparatus entrusted to me.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: You both have my thanks. With our wares safely stored away, we'll not lose any more to those fiends.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I take it that your establishment did not escape the attack unscathed?

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: We did not. Thankfully, most of our workers had already left for the day. But those of us still here saw it all...

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: We looked to the burning skies in confusion...and then, before we could even begin to make sense of it, a hideous creature burst through the doors, shrieking...

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: We ran for our lives, but one of my colleagues was not so fortunate. He cried out─a scream of such agony, such terror─and in the next instant, he, too, sprouted fearsome claws...

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: The sight of it caused another fellow to panic, and then...

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: He, too, transformed...

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: ...I'm sorry. There was something you wanted to ask?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Indeed. You knew the merchant Khalzahl, did you not? I believe he had some dealings with your establishment.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: Khalzahl? I know him well. We'd arranged for his consortium to deliver a large shipment of fabrics, but in the end, we received a better offer, and had to turn him down.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: I understand his business is struggling, but so is ours. Another of our most reliable trading partners agreed to transport the goods for a much smaller commission, and we'd have been fools to refuse.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: I felt terrible for withdrawing the offer...but you must understand, we simply had no choice.

dialogue.name: DJINABAHA
dialogue.text: He tried to put on a brave face when I delivered the news, but his dejection and despair were plain as day. He said he'd discuss it with his associates, but I could tell he'd all but given up hope...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Dejection...and despair.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: You remember what we saw in Vanaspati, yes? Soldiers and jungle dwellers pushed to the very brink turning into beasts one after the next...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It would seem the same phenomenon occurred here. The poor craftsmen attacked by the fiends, as well as those that witnessed it...all undergoing the change.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I suspect that everything began with Khalzahl. By all accounts, it was he who suffered from the most profound and piercing despair...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Wait. Could that be it? That such intense emotions were what triggered his transformation?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Much remains unclear, but I believe we are drawing closer to an answer. At any rate, we must discuss our findings with the others.
